title: Buddy Tate - 1975 - The Texas Twister (1987) FLAC
description:
Buddy Tate - 1975 - The Texas Twister (1987)

The music on this New World release (originally put out by Master Jazz) is very much in the vein of Count Basie. Buddy Tate (playing tenor and clarinet in addition to taking a few of Jimmy Rushing-style vocals) is joined by fellow tenor Paul Quinichette (making one of his few recordings of the 1970's), pianist Cliff Smalls (an underrated swing player), bassist Major Holley and drummer Jackie Williams. Other than the opening original "The Texas Twister" and Tate's ballad feature on "Talk Of The Town," all of the music is from the Basie book including "Chicago," "Boogie Woogie" and "Topsy." All of the musicians (most of whom were not making too many recordings in the mid-1970's) sound somewhat inspired and are in fine form. (AllMusic)

Track list:
01 - The Texas Twister
02 - Talk Of The Town
03 - Take Me Back Baby, Part One
04 - Take Me Back Baby, Part Two
05 - Chicago
06 - Boogie Woogie
07 - Topsy
08 - Gee Baby, Ain't I Good To You

Pesonnel:
BUDDY TATE , tenor saxophone, clarinet, vocals
PAUL QUINICHETTE, tenor saxophone
CLIFF SMALLS, piano
MAJOR HOLLEY, bass
JACKIE WILLIAMS, drums

Enjoy and share!
